019package org.jgrapes.http;
020
021import java.lang.management.ManagementFactory;
022import java.lang.ref.WeakReference;
023import java.net.HttpCookie;
024import java.security.SecureRandom;
025import java.time.Duration;
026import java.time.Instant;
027import java.util.HashSet;
028import java.util.Optional;
029import java.util.Set;
030import java.util.function.Supplier;
031import javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException;
032import javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException;
033import javax.management.MBeanRegistrationException;
034import javax.management.MBeanServer;
035import javax.management.MalformedObjectNameException;
036import javax.management.NotCompliantMBeanException;
037import javax.management.ObjectName;
038import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.protocols.http.HttpField;
039import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.protocols.http.HttpRequest;
040import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.protocols.http.HttpResponse;
041import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.types.CacheControlDirectives;
042import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.types.Converters;
043import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.types.CookieList;
044import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.types.Directive;
045import org.jgrapes.core.Associator;
046import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
047import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
048import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
049import org.jgrapes.core.Components.Timer;
050import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
051import org.jgrapes.core.internal.EventBase;
052import org.jgrapes.http.annotation.RequestHandler;
053import org.jgrapes.http.events.DiscardSession;
054import org.jgrapes.http.events.ProtocolSwitchAccepted;
055import org.jgrapes.http.events.Request;
056import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel;
057
058/**
059 * A base class for session managers. A session manager associates 
060 * {@link Request} events with a 
061 * {@link Supplier {@code Supplier<Optional<Session>>}}
062 * for a {@link Session} using `Session.class` as association identifier
063 * (see {@link Session#from}). Note that the `Optional` will never by
064 * empty. The return type has been chosen to be in accordance with
065 * {@link Associator#associatedGet(Class)}.
066 * 
067 * The {@link Request} handler has a default priority of 1000.
068 * 
069 * Managers track requests using a cookie with a given name and path. The 
070 * path is a prefix that has to be matched by the request, often "/".
071 * If no cookie with the given name (see {@link #idName()}) is found,
072 * a new cookie with that name and the specified path is created.
073 * The cookie's value is the unique session id that is used to lookup
074 * the session object.
075 * 
076 * Session managers provide additional support for web sockets. If a
077 * web socket is accepted, the session associated with the request
078 * is automatically made available to the {@link IOSubchannel} that
079 * is subsequently used for the web socket events. This allows
080 * handlers for web socket messages to access the session like
081 * {@link Request} handlers (see {@link #onProtocolSwitchAccepted}).
082 * 
083 * @see EventBase#setAssociated(Object, Object)
084 * @see "[OWASP Session Management Cheat Sheet](https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet)"
085 */
086@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.DataClass", "PMD.AvoidPrintStackTrace",
087    "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis", "PMD.TooManyMethods" })
088public abstract class SessionManager extends Component {
089
090    private static SecureRandom secureRandom = new SecureRandom();
091
092    private String idName = "id";
093    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ImmutableField")
094    private String path = "/";
095    private long absoluteTimeout = 9 * 60 * 60 * 1000;
096    private long idleTimeout = 30 * 60 * 1000;
097    private int maxSessions = 1000;
098    private Timer nextPurge;
099
100    /**
101     * Creates a new session manager with its channel set to
102     * itself and the path set to "/". The manager handles
103     * all {@link Request} events.
104     */
105    public SessionManager() {
106        this("/");
107    }
108
109    /**
110     * Creates a new session manager with its channel set to
111     * itself and the path set to the given path. The manager
112     * handles all requests that match the given path, using the
113     * same rules as browsers do for selecting the cookies that
114     * are to be sent.
115     * 
116     * @param path the path
117     */
118    public SessionManager(String path) {
119        this(Channel.SELF, path);
120    }
121
122    /**
123     * Creates a new session manager with its channel set to
124     * the given channel and the path to "/". The manager handles
125     * all {@link Request} events.
126     * 
127     * @param componentChannel the component channel
128     */
129    public SessionManager(Channel componentChannel) {
130        this(componentChannel, "/");
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Creates a new session manager with the given channel and path.
135     * The manager handles all requests that match the given path, using
136     * the same rules as browsers do for selecting the cookies that
137     * are to be sent.
138     *  
139     * @param componentChannel the component channel
140     * @param path the path
141     */
142    public SessionManager(Channel componentChannel, String path) {
143        this(componentChannel, derivePattern(path), 1000, path);
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Derives the resource pattern from the path.
148     *
149     * @param path the path
150     * @return the pattern
151     */
152    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
153    protected static String derivePattern(String path) {
154        String pattern;
155        if ("/".equals(path)) {
156            pattern = "/**";
157        } else {
158            String patternBase = path;
159            if (patternBase.endsWith("/")) {
160                patternBase = path.substring(0, path.length() - 1);
161            }
162            pattern = patternBase + "|," + patternBase + "/**";
163        }
164        return pattern;
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * Creates a new session manager using the given channel and path.
169     * The manager handles only requests that match the given pattern.
170     * The handler is registered with the given priority.
171     * 
172     * This constructor can be used if special handling of top level
173     * requests is needed.
174     *
175     * @param componentChannel the component channel
176     * @param pattern the path part of a {@link ResourcePattern}
177     * @param priority the priority
178     * @param path the path
179     */
180    public SessionManager(Channel componentChannel, String pattern,
181            int priority, String path) {
182        super(componentChannel);
183        this.path = path;
184        RequestHandler.Evaluator.add(this, "onRequest", pattern, priority);
185        MBeanView.addManager(this);
186    }
187
188    private Optional<Long> minTimeout() {
189        if (absoluteTimeout > 0 && idleTimeout > 0) {
190            return Optional.of(Math.min(absoluteTimeout, idleTimeout));
191        }
192        if (absoluteTimeout > 0) {
193            return Optional.of(absoluteTimeout);
194        }
195        if (idleTimeout > 0) {
196            return Optional.of(idleTimeout);
197        }
198        return Optional.empty();
199    }
200
201    private void startPurger() {
202        synchronized (this) {
203            if (nextPurge == null) {
204                minTimeout().ifPresent(timeout -> Components
205                    .schedule(this::purgeAction, Duration.ofMillis(timeout)));
206            }
207        }
208    }
209
210    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UnusedFormalParameter")
211    private void purgeAction(Timer timer) {
212        nextPurge = startDiscarding(absoluteTimeout, idleTimeout)
213            .map(nextAt -> Components.schedule(this::purgeAction, nextAt))
214            .orElse(null);
215    }
216
217    /**
218     * The name used for the session id cookie. Defaults to "`id`".
219     * 
220     * @return the id name
221     */
222    public String idName() {
223        return idName;
224    }
225
226    /**
227     * @param idName the id name to set
228     * 
229     * @return the session manager for easy chaining
230     */
231    public SessionManager setIdName(String idName) {
232        this.idName = idName;
233        return this;
234    }
235
236    /**
237     * Set the maximum number of sessions. If the value is zero or less,
238     * an unlimited number of sessions is supported. The default value
239     * is 1000.
240     * 
241     * If adding a new session would exceed the limit, first all
242     * sessions older than {@link #absoluteTimeout()} are removed.
243     * If this doesn't free a slot, the least recently used session
244     * is removed.
245     * 
246     * @param maxSessions the maxSessions to set
247     * @return the session manager for easy chaining
248     */
249    public SessionManager setMaxSessions(int maxSessions) {
250        this.maxSessions = maxSessions;
251        return this;
252    }
253
254    /**
255     * @return the maxSessions
256     */
257    public int maxSessions() {
258        return maxSessions;
259    }
260
261    /**
262     * Sets the absolute timeout for a session. The absolute
263     * timeout is the time after which a session is invalidated (relative
264     * to its creation time). Defaults to 9 hours. Zero or less disables
265     * the timeout.
266     * 
267     * @param timeout the absolute timeout
268     * @return the session manager for easy chaining
269     */
270    public SessionManager setAbsoluteTimeout(Duration timeout) {
271        this.absoluteTimeout = timeout.toMillis();
272        return this;
273    }
274
275    /**
276     * @return the absolute session timeout (in seconds)
277     */
278    public Duration absoluteTimeout() {
279        return Duration.ofMillis(absoluteTimeout);
280    }
281
282    /**
283     * Sets the idle timeout for a session. Defaults to 30 minutes.
284     * Zero or less disables the timeout. 
285     * 
286     * @param timeout the absolute timeout
287     * @return the session manager for easy chaining
288     */
289    public SessionManager setIdleTimeout(Duration timeout) {
290        this.idleTimeout = timeout.toMillis();
291        return this;
292    }
293
294    /**
295     * @return the idle timeout
296     */
297    public Duration idleTimeout() {
298        return Duration.ofMillis(idleTimeout);
299    }
300
301    /**
302     * Associates the event with a {@link Session} object
303     * using `Session.class` as association identifier.
304     * 
305     * @param event the event
306     */
307    @RequestHandler(dynamic = true)
308    public void onRequest(Request.In event) {
309        if (event.associated(Session.class).isPresent()) {
310            return;
311        }
312        final HttpRequest request = event.httpRequest();
313        Optional<String> requestedSessionId = request.findValue(
314            HttpField.COOKIE, Converters.COOKIE_LIST)
315            .flatMap(cookies -> cookies.stream().filter(
316                cookie -> cookie.getName().equals(idName()))
317                .findFirst().map(HttpCookie::getValue));
318        if (requestedSessionId.isPresent()) {
319            String sessionId = requestedSessionId.get();
320            synchronized (this) {
321                Optional<Session> session = lookupSession(sessionId);
322                if (session.isPresent()) {
323                    setSessionSupplier(event, session.get().id());
324                    session.get().updateLastUsedAt();
325                    return;
326                }
327            }
328        }
329        Session session = createSession(
330            addSessionCookie(request.response().get(), createSessionId()));
331        setSessionSupplier(event, session.id());
332        startPurger();
333    }
334
335    /**
336     * Associated the associator with a session supplier for the 
337     * given session id.
338     *
339     * @param holder the channel
340     * @param sessionId the session id
341     */
342    protected void setSessionSupplier(Associator holder, String sessionId) {
343        holder.setAssociated(Session.class,
344            new SessionSupplier(holder, sessionId));
345    }
346
347    /**
348     * Supports obtaining a {@link Session} from an {@link IOSubchannel}. 
349     */
350    private class SessionSupplier implements Supplier<Optional<Session>> {
351
352        private final Associator holder;
353        private final String sessionId;
354
355        /**
356         * Instantiates a new session supplier.
357         *
358         * @param holder the channel
359         * @param sessionId the session id
360         */
361        public SessionSupplier(Associator holder, String sessionId) {
362            this.holder = holder;
363            this.sessionId = sessionId;
364        }
365
366        @Override
367        public Optional<Session> get() {
368            Optional<Session> session = lookupSession(sessionId);
369            if (session.isPresent()) {
370                session.get().updateLastUsedAt();
371                return session;
372            }
373            Session newSession = createSession(createSessionId());
374            setSessionSupplier(holder, newSession.id());
375            return Optional.of(newSession);
376        }
377
378    }
379
380    /**
381     * Creates a session id and adds the corresponding cookie to the
382     * response.
383     * 
384     * @param response the response
385     * @return the session id
386     */
387    protected String addSessionCookie(HttpResponse response, String sessionId) {
388        HttpCookie sessionCookie = new HttpCookie(idName(), sessionId);
389        sessionCookie.setPath(path);
390        sessionCookie.setHttpOnly(true);
391        response.computeIfAbsent(HttpField.SET_COOKIE, CookieList::new)
392            .value().add(sessionCookie);
393        response.computeIfAbsent(
394            HttpField.CACHE_CONTROL, CacheControlDirectives::new).value()
395            .add(new Directive("no-cache", "SetCookie, Set-Cookie2"));
396        return sessionId;
397    }
398
399    private String createSessionId() {
400        StringBuilder sessionIdBuilder = new StringBuilder();
401        byte[] bytes = new byte[16];
402        secureRandom.nextBytes(bytes);
403        for (byte b : bytes) {
404            sessionIdBuilder.append(Integer.toHexString(b & 0xff));
405        }
406        return sessionIdBuilder.toString();
407    }
408
409    /**
410     * Checks if the absolute or idle timeout has been reached.
411     *
412     * @param session the session
413     * @return true, if successful
414     */
415    protected boolean hasTimedOut(Session session) {
416        Instant now = Instant.now();
417        return absoluteTimeout > 0 && Duration
418            .between(session.createdAt(), now).toMillis() > absoluteTimeout
419            || idleTimeout > 0 && Duration.between(session.lastUsedAt(),
420                now).toMillis() > idleTimeout;
421    }
422
423    /**
424     * Start discarding all sessions (generate {@link DiscardSession} events)
425     * that have reached their absolute or idle timeout. Do not
426     * make the sessions unavailable yet. 
427     * 
428     * Returns the time when the next timeout occurs. This method is 
429     * called only if at least one of the timeouts has been specified.
430     * 
431     * Implementations have to take care that sessions are only discarded
432     * once. As they must remain available while the {@link DiscardSession}
433     * event is handled this may require marking them as being discarded. 
434     *
435     * @param absoluteTimeout the absolute timeout
436     * @param idleTimeout the idle timeout
437     * @return the next timeout (empty if no sessions left)
438     */
439    protected abstract Optional<Instant> startDiscarding(long absoluteTimeout,
440            long idleTimeout);
441
442    /**
443     * Creates a new session with the given id.
444     * 
445     * @param sessionId
446     * @return the session
447     */
448    protected abstract Session createSession(String sessionId);
449
450    /**
451     * Lookup the session with the given id. Lookup will fail if
452     * the session has timed out.
453     * 
454     * @param sessionId
455     * @return the session
456     */
457    protected abstract Optional<Session> lookupSession(String sessionId);
458
459    /**
460     * Removes the given session from the cache.
461     * 
462     * @param sessionId the session id
463     */
464    protected abstract void removeSession(String sessionId);
465
466    /**
467     * Return the number of established sessions.
468     * 
469     * @return the result
470     */
471    protected abstract int sessionCount();
472
473    /**
474     * Discards the given session. The handler has a priority of -1000,
475     * thus allowing other handler to make use of the session (for a
476     * time) before it becomes unavailable.
477     * 
478     * @param event the event
479     */
480    @Handler(channels = Channel.class, priority = -1000)
481    public void onDiscard(DiscardSession event) {
482        removeSession(event.session().id());
483        event.session().close();
484    }
485
486    /**
487     * Associates the channel with a 
488     * {@link Supplier {@code Supplier<Optional<Session>>}} 
489     * for the session. Initially, the associated session is the session
490     * associated with the protocol switch event. If this session times out,
491     * a new session is returned as a fallback, thus making sure that
492     * the `Optional` is never empty. The new session is, however, created 
493     * independently of any new session created by {@link #onRequest}.
494     * 
495     * Applications should avoid any ambiguity by executing a proper 
496     * cleanup of the web application in response to a 
497     * {@link DiscardSession} event (including reestablishing the web
498     * socket connections from new requests).
499     * 
500     * @param event the event
501     * @param channel the channel
502     */
503    @Handler(priority = 1000)
504    public void onProtocolSwitchAccepted(
505            ProtocolSwitchAccepted event, IOSubchannel channel) {
506        setSessionSupplier(channel, Session.from(event.requestEvent()).id());
507    }
508
509    /**
510     * An MBean interface for getting information about the 
511     * established sessions.
512     */
513    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CommentRequired")
514    public interface SessionManagerMXBean {
515
516        String getComponentPath();
517
518        String getPath();
519
520        int getMaxSessions();
521
522        long getAbsoluteTimeout();
523
524        long getIdleTimeout();
525
526        int getSessionCount();
527    }
528
529    /**
530     * The session manager information.
531     */
532    public static class SessionManagerInfo implements SessionManagerMXBean {
533
534        private static MBeanServer mbs
535            = ManagementFactory.getPlatformMBeanServer();
536
537        private ObjectName mbeanName;
538        private final WeakReference<SessionManager> sessionManagerRef;
539
540        /**
541         * Instantiates a new session manager info.
542         *
543         * @param sessionManager the session manager
544         */
545        @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidCatchingGenericException",
546            "PMD.EmptyCatchBlock" })
547        public SessionManagerInfo(SessionManager sessionManager) {
548            try {
549                mbeanName = new ObjectName("org.jgrapes.http:type="
550                    + SessionManager.class.getSimpleName() + ",name="
551                    + ObjectName.quote(Components.simpleObjectName(
552                        sessionManager)));
553            } catch (MalformedObjectNameException e) {
554                // Won't happen
555            }
556            sessionManagerRef = new WeakReference<>(sessionManager);
557            try {
558                mbs.unregisterMBean(mbeanName);
559            } catch (Exception e) {
560                // Just in case, should not work
561            }
562            try {
563                mbs.registerMBean(this, mbeanName);
564            } catch (InstanceAlreadyExistsException | MBeanRegistrationException
565                    | NotCompliantMBeanException e) {
566                // Have to live with that
567            }
568        }
569
570        /**
571         * Returns the session manager.
572         *
573         * @return the optional session manager
574         */
575        @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidCatchingGenericException",
576            "PMD.EmptyCatchBlock" })
577        public Optional<SessionManager> manager() {
578            SessionManager manager = sessionManagerRef.get();
579            if (manager == null) {
580                try {
581                    mbs.unregisterMBean(mbeanName);
582                } catch (MBeanRegistrationException
583                        | InstanceNotFoundException e) {
584                    // Should work.
585                }
586            }
587            return Optional.ofNullable(manager);
588        }
589
590        @Override
591        public String getComponentPath() {
592            return manager().map(mgr -> mgr.componentPath())
593                .orElse("<removed>");
594        }
595
596        @Override
597        public String getPath() {
598            return manager().map(mgr -> mgr.path).orElse("<unknown>");
599        }
600
601        @Override
602        public int getMaxSessions() {
603            return manager().map(mgr -> mgr.maxSessions()).orElse(0);
604        }
605
606        @Override
607        public long getAbsoluteTimeout() {
608            return manager().map(mgr -> mgr.absoluteTimeout().toMillis())
609                .orElse(0L);
610        }
611
612        @Override
613        public long getIdleTimeout() {
614            return manager().map(mgr -> mgr.idleTimeout().toMillis())
615                .orElse(0L);
616        }
617
618        @Override
619        public int getSessionCount() {
620            return manager().map(mgr -> mgr.sessionCount()).orElse(0);
621        }
622    }
623
624    /**
625     * An MBean interface for getting information about all session
626     * managers.
627     * 
628     * There is currently no summary information. However, the (periodic)
629     * invocation of {@link SessionManagerSummaryMXBean#getManagers()} ensures
630     * that entries for removed {@link SessionManager}s are unregistered.
631     */
632    public interface SessionManagerSummaryMXBean {
633
634        /**
635         * Gets the managers.
636         *
637         * @return the managers
638         */
639        Set<SessionManagerMXBean> getManagers();
640    }
641
642    /**
643     * The MBean view.
644     */
645    private static class MBeanView implements SessionManagerSummaryMXBean {
646        private static Set<SessionManagerInfo> managerInfos = new HashSet<>();
647
648        /**
649         * Adds a manager.
650         *
651         * @param manager the manager
652         */
653        public static void addManager(SessionManager manager) {
654            synchronized (managerInfos) {
655                managerInfos.add(new SessionManagerInfo(manager));
656            }
657        }
658
659        @Override
660        public Set<SessionManagerMXBean> getManagers() {
661            Set<SessionManagerInfo> expired = new HashSet<>();
662            synchronized (managerInfos) {
663                for (SessionManagerInfo managerInfo : managerInfos) {
664                    if (!managerInfo.manager().isPresent()) {
665                        expired.add(managerInfo);
666                    }
667                }
668                managerInfos.removeAll(expired);
669            }
670            @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
671            Set<SessionManagerMXBean> result
672                = (Set<SessionManagerMXBean>) (Object) managerInfos;
673            return result;
674        }
675    }
676
677    static {
678        try {
679            MBeanServer mbs = ManagementFactory.getPlatformMBeanServer();
680            ObjectName mxbeanName = new ObjectName("org.jgrapes.http:type="
681                + SessionManager.class.getSimpleName() + "s");
682            mbs.registerMBean(new MBeanView(), mxbeanName);
683        } catch (MalformedObjectNameException | InstanceAlreadyExistsException
684                | MBeanRegistrationException | NotCompliantMBeanException e) {
685            // Does not happen
686            e.printStackTrace();
687        }
688    }
689}
